criteria: Identification of Binge Eating Disorder Signs
descriptions: Student cannot identify any signs of anorexia nervosa.
Student identifies only 1-2 basic signs of anorexia nervosa, with limited accuracy.
Student identifies some signs of anorexia nervosa, but shows gaps in understanding or omits key indicators.
Student accurately identifies several signs of anorexia nervosa, demonstrating a reasonable understanding.
Student comprehensively identifies most major signs of anorexia nervosa, showing good understanding and detail.
Student thoroughly and accurately identifies a wide range of signs of anorexia nervosa, demonstrating excellent understanding and insightful awareness.
Student cannot identify any signs of bulimia nervosa.
Student identifies only 1-2 basic signs of bulimia nervosa, with limited accuracy.
Student identifies some signs of bulimia nervosa, but shows gaps in understanding or omits key indicators.
Student accurately identifies several signs of bulimia nervosa, demonstrating a reasonable understanding.
Student comprehensively identifies most major signs of bulimia nervosa, showing good understanding and detail.
Student thoroughly and accurately identifies a wide range of signs of bulimia nervosa, demonstrating excellent understanding, including compensatory behaviors.
Student cannot identify any signs of binge eating disorder.
Student identifies only 1-2 basic signs of binge eating disorder, with limited accuracy.
Student identifies some signs of binge eating disorder, but shows gaps in understanding or omits key indicators.
Student accurately identifies several signs of binge eating disorder, demonstrating a reasonable understanding.
Student comprehensively identifies most major signs of binge eating disorder, showing good understanding and detail.
Student thoroughly and accurately identifies a wide range of signs of binge eating disorder, demonstrating excellent understanding of both eating behaviors and related distress.
Student is unable to differentiate between the signs of different eating disorders.
Student shows minimal ability to distinguish between eating disorders, confusing signs and symptoms.
Student demonstrates some ability to differentiate, but with inaccuracies or omissions.
Student can generally differentiate between the main signs of anorexia, bulimia, and binge eating disorder.
Student clearly differentiates between the signs of various eating disorders, demonstrating a solid understanding of their unique characteristics.
Student expertly differentiates between eating disorders, highlighting nuanced differences in signs and symptoms and demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
